t: Lamentations 2
God’s Anger with Jerusalem

How*pn the Lord has covered the daughter of Zion With*ld a cloud in His anger! He*ld cast down from heaven to the earth The*ld beauty of Israel, And*ld did not remember His footstool In*ld the day of His anger.

The*ln Lord has swallowed up and has not pitied All*ld the dwelling places of Jacob. He*ld has thrown down in His wrath The*ld strongholds of the daughter of Judah; He*ld has brought them*i down to the ground; He*ld has profaned the kingdom and its princes.
He*ln has cut off in fierce anger Every*ld horn of Israel; He*ld has drawn back His right hand From*ld before the enemy. He*ld has blazed against Jacob like a flaming fire Devouring*ld all around.

Standing*ln like an enemy, He has bent His bow; With*ld His right hand, like an adversary, He*ld has slain all who*i were*i pleasing to His eye; On*ld the tent of the daughter of Zion, He*ld has poured out His fury like fire.

The*ln Lord was like an enemy. He*ld has swallowed up Israel, He*ld has swallowed up all her palaces; He*ld has destroyed her strongholds, And*ld has increased mourning and lamentation In*ld the daughter of Judah.

He*ln has done violence to His tabernacle, As*ild if*i it*i were*i a garden; He*ld has destroyed His place of assembly; The*ld Lord*s has caused The*ld appointed feasts and Sabbaths to be forgotten in Zion. In*ld His burning indignation He has spurned the king and the priest.

The*ln Lord has spurned His altar, He*ld has abandoned His sanctuary; He*ld has given up the walls of her palaces Into*ld the hand of the enemy. They*ld have made a noise in the house of the Lord*s As*ld on the day of a set feast.

The*ln Lord*s has purposed to destroy The*ld wall of the daughter of Zion. He*ld has stretched out a line; He*ld has not withdrawn His hand from destroying; Therefore*ld He has caused the rampart and wall to lament; They*ld languished together.

Her*ln gates have sunk into the ground; He*ld has destroyed and broken her bars. Her*ld king and her princes are*i among the nations; The*ld Law is*i no more,*i And*ld her prophets find no vision from the Lord.*s

The*ln elders of the daughter of Zion Sit*ld on the ground and*i keep silence; They*ld throw dust on their heads And*ld gird themselves with sackcloth. The*ld virgins of Jerusalem Bow*ld their heads to the ground.

My*ln eyes fail with tears, My*ld heart is troubled; My*ld bile is poured on the ground Because*ld of the destruction of the daughter of my people, Because*ld the children and the infants Faint*ld in the streets of the city.
They*ln say to their mothers, “Where*ld is*i grain and wine?” As*ld they swoon like the wounded In*ld the streets of the city, As*ld their life is poured out In*ld their mothers’ bosom.

How*ln shall I console you? To*ld what shall I liken you, O*ld daughter of Jerusalem? What*ld shall I compare with you, that I may comfort you, O*ld virgin daughter of Zion? For*ld your ruin is*i spread wide as the sea; Who*ld can heal you?

Your*ln prophets have seen for you False*ld and deceptive visions; They*ld have not uncovered your iniquity, To*ld bring back your captives, But*ld have envisioned for you false prophecies and delusions.

All*ln who pass by clap their*i hands at you; They*ld hiss and shake their heads At*ld the daughter of Jerusalem: “Is*ild this the city that is called ‘The*ld perfection of beauty, The*ld joy of the whole earth’?”

All*ln your enemies have opened their mouth against you; They*ld hiss and gnash their*i teeth. They*ld say, “We have swallowed her*i up! Surely*ld this is*i the day we have waited for; We*ld have found it,*i we have seen it!”*i

The*ln Lord*s has done what He purposed; He*ld has fulfilled His word Which*ld He commanded in days of old. He*ld has thrown down and has not pitied, And*ld He has caused an enemy to rejoice over you; He*ld has exalted the horn of your adversaries.
Their*ln heart cried out to the Lord, “O*ld wall of the daughter of Zion, Let*ld tears run down like a river day and night; Give*ld yourself no relief; Give*ld your eyes no rest.

“Arise,*ln cry out in the night, At*ld the beginning of the watches; Pour*ld out your heart like water before the face of the Lord. Lift*ld your hands toward Him For*ld the life of your young children, Who*ld faint from hunger at the head of every street.”

“See,*ln O Lord,*s and consider! To*ld whom have You done this? Should*ld the women eat their offspring, The*ld children they have cuddled? Should*ld the priest and prophet be slain In*ld the sanctuary of the Lord?

“Young*ln and old lie On*ld the ground in the streets; My*ld virgins and my young men Have*ld fallen by the sword; You*ld have slain them*i in the day of Your anger, You*ld have slaughtered and*i not pitied.

“You*ln have invited as to a feast day The*ld terrors that surround me. In*ld the day of the Lord’s*s anger There*ld was no refugee or survivor. Those*ld whom I have borne and brought up My*ld enemies have destroyed.”
